newsitem.title: ALBANIA: Albanian parliament lifts state of emergency.
newsitem.headline: Albanian parliament lifts state of emergency.

text.p: Albania's parliament on Thursday lifted a state of emergency and curfew introduced on March 2 after an armed uprising broke out in response to the collapse of pyramid investment schemes.
All 104 deputies attending the session voted in favour of the measure, which takes effect immediately, ending a nationwide 10 p.m. to 5 a.m. curfew.
Deputies of parliament's new Socialist majority said the move got their government off to a good start.
"The Socialist Party does not wish to elect the new president with the law on the state of emergency in force," said Pandeli Majko, head of the Socialist parliamentary group.
Socialist Party leader and prime minister designate Fatos Nano said: "We should replace the emergency of the destruction of our institutions with the emergency of their construction."

The session then began debate on a new president, expected to be Socialist secretary-general Rexhep Mejdani. Outgoing president Sali Berisha resigned hours before the new parliament opened on Wednesday to take a seat as an opposition deputy.
